authorsByline: Travis Jacque Rose, Anderson Independent Mail
title: New $25 million affordable housing development being built in Anderson, 65 to 80 apartments
description: A new housing development with affordable housing options is being constructed in Anderson with frontage on West Franklin St. and South Murray Ave.
content:
A new housing development with affordable housing options is being constructed in Anderson with frontage on West Franklin Street and South Murray Avenue.

Southeast Partners and the City of Anderson are collaborating on the development, which will be called The Franklin.

Prestwick Development was awarded 2024 South Carolina low-income housing tax credits for the new development. The Housing Tax Credit Program was designed to provide developers with an incentive to create and maintain affordable housing.

The company will invest $25 million in The Franklin, which will include between 68 and 80 new apartments, contingent upon the final design of the building.

“We are thankful for our partnership with Prestwick,” said David McCuen, Anderson City Manager. “This site was identified for development in the City’s Neighborhood Revitalization Plan, and it was important for us to find the right partners who shared our vision for its future use.”

In May 2024, 11 parcels of land comprising approximately 3.5 acres were rezoned for a Planned Development District, according to Planning Director Maurice McKenzie.

Construction will be completed within 12 to 16 months.

According to project plans, this development would provide affordable housing options, targeting extremely low to low-income renter households earning at or below 20 percent, 50 percent, and 60 percent of the area median income.

The property will be one mid-rise building with a split, three-story design, accompanied by adjacent surface parking.

The Franklin apartments will feature a variety of unit types and community amenities to cater to singles, couples, and families with children.

Additionally, community amenities and a leasing office will be integrated into the building.

The parking lot will be to the west of the building, with green space in the northwest corner and a detention pond in the southwest corner.

The Franklin will offer 20 one-bedroom units, 24 two-bedroom units, and 24 three-bedroom units.
• None One-bedroom units will have one bathroom and are 840 square feet.
• None Two-bedroom units will have two bathrooms and 1,022 square feet.
• None Three-bedroom units will have two bathrooms and 1,233 square feet.

The property will also include trash removal costs in the rent. All other utilities are the tenant's responsibility.

Travis Rose covers Anderson County for the Independent Mail. Reach him via email at trose@gannett.com.
